thread.title: PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron on house building figures
thread.title_full: PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron on house building figures - BBC News

author: BBC
title: PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron on house building figures
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron on house building figures 14 October 2015 Last updated at 13:32 BST
Jeremy Corbyn uses a question from Matthew - one of 3,500 submitted to him on housing – to ask the prime minister about buying a home in London.
David Cameron said “we are doing everything we can” to get councils to build more houses, and he wanted to see starter homes in the capital in the £150,000 to £200,000 price range.
And he asked the Labour leader to work together to “get London building to get prices down.”
BBC Politics Live: PMQs in text and video
Read more PMQs: Corbyn and Cameron clash over tax credits
